CHANNEL
STUDIOS—UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON
TRANSMITTER—EDISON TECHNICAL SCHOOL
KCTS-TV
SEATTLE 5, WASHINGTON
November 5, 1962
Bill Harley
NAEB
Washington, D. C.
Dear Bill:
Even after ten days have elapsed since the NAEB Board
meeting, I am no mere satisfied or pleased with the
action the Board took on the matter of television
production than I was at the time*
It seems to me that the Board made it abundantly clear
that they don’t want the television stations in the
association, or certainly not with the stations them¬
selves having any real voice in what the association
does to or for them. It should have been fully clear
to Hull, Miles, etc. that the Stations were and are
greatly opposed to NAEB being in television production.
I would like you to send me a copy of just what action
the Board took — I understand they took some sort of
action while I was out of the meeting, and I would like
to be accurate in what I report to the stations, for I
have a responsibility to report to the stations just what
the NAEB Board did on the matter, and I don’t wish to be
inaccurate in my reporting.
I am sure that our station will not continue its member¬
ship in NAEB, although I will continue as an individual
member. It appears clear to me that the stations are
going to have to create some mechanism for themselves
that will not be controlled by non-station-managers. I
think we will reserve our dues and energies for something
that will be responsive to our own needs -- which are great.
Loren B. Stone
NOV 7 1962
